There was a memory leak here. This code is very bad.

Also improved perf by about 5% by removing the Rc clones.

candidates.title: chore: upgrade terminal dependencies
feat: lsp
candidates.body:
Continuation of https://github.com/dprint/dprint/pull/741

Seems to work in neovim.

```
:lua vim.lsp.start({ name='dprint', cmd={'V:\\dprint\\target\\debug\\dprint.exe', 'lsp'} })
:lua vim.lsp.buf.format()
```

Other helpful neovim commands:

```
# enable debug logging
:lua vim.lsp.set_log_level('debug')
# get log file name
:lua =require('vim.lsp.log').get_filename()
```

Todo:

- [ ] Schemas for dprint.json files

Closes https://github.com/dprint/dprint/issues/738

candidates.title: fix(core): AsyncPluginHandler - remove Send + Sync
candidates.body: Leftover code from the past.

candidates.title: feat: support formatting `Vec<u8>` (not just utf-8 strings)
candidates.body:
This allows dprint (as a platform) to format any kind of data by storing the files as `Vec<u8>` instead of utf-8 strings. Currently most of the plugins still assume utf-8 strings.

Probably also a slight non-noticable perf improvement because the CLI no longer needlessly converts from `Vec<u8>` to `String` except when outputting diffs.

Closes https://github.com/dprint/dprint/issues/790

candidates.title: fix: resolve 'system' newline global config in CLI
candidates.body:
Note: In order for this to work it requires dprint 0.43.0 and for the newline kind configuration to be set at the top level.

The reason the bug occurs is because the plugins get compiled to wasm and so they have no concept of operating system at that point. The fix is to resolve this in the CLI and then passed the resolved global config to the plugins. This also means I will be removing the "system" config from the wasm plugins gradually in the future.

All that said, I highly recommend that Windows devs just use LF newlines. I work on Windows and that's what I do and it's absolutely fine. It leads to less complexity. Just make sure your git config is to check-out newlines "as-is" instead of having it mess with stuff by converting newlines.

Related https://github.com/dprint/dprint-plugin-typescript/issues/499

Closes #776

candidates.title: perf: ensure incremental cache doesn't get invalidated via unstable jsonc deserialization
candidates.body: I noticed that the incremental formatting cache was being invalidated for certain configs. This was because jsonc-parser had an unstable deserialization, so I fixed that in https://github.com/dprint/jsonc-parser/pull/39

candidates.title: fix: key wasm plugin cache on rustc version
candidates.body: After I upgraded to the latest dprint version, I found that the wasm cache was corrupted. It would be best to key on the version of rustc used to build dprint.

candidates.title: feat: monitor and throttle CPU if necessary
candidates.body:
This checks CPU usage every 2 seconds after an initial 5 second delay and will scale back formatting.

This will help not overload someone's machine on very large repositories like DefinitelyTyped.

Closes #710

candidates.body: I'm not sure why it wasn't formatting the panic message. This fixes it by unwrapping.

candidates.title: fix: handle multiple processes writing to Wasm cache at the same time
candidates.body: Do an "atomic write" for more operations where it writes to a temporary file then renames.

candidates.title: fix: restrict process plugin initialization to one process at a time
feat: Add shell completions generator
candidates.body:
This should add support for generating [tab completion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command-line_completion) scripts in run-time using `clap_complete`.

---

It could be done in compile-time, but first we need to isolate the `create_cli_parser` function in a separate file so we can `include!()` it in the `build.rs` file without any complexity.
